channel.title: Posts on cs-ej4101-fall-2019-076-advanced
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on cs-ej4101-fall-2019-076-advanced

item.title: Learned 076
item.description: In this course I learned: How to configure travis (seems pretty similar to CircleCi and Gitlab) A bit more about Hugo (and Hugo seems really nice <3) More about github access tokens I also developed a bit more paranoia about github access keys, as it seems like one can't define the keys per repo. This is bad, as the keys can leak and allow questionable actors to change my other repos.

item.title: This Course 076
item.description: I decided to take this course, as I was missing one (1) credit from my thesis and this seemed interesting. I am writing my thesis about DevOps, so ROI should be okay :] I feel that DevOps done right (eg. really applied and not just advocated) is a good way to make software development less wasteful and alleviate the deployment pain. In my thesis research I found interesting book about DevOps and it's impact.

item.title: Hello World
item.description: Please remember to fix climate change and other coordination problems! Plz!
